content: stocking garland by the blue mouse 1 materials sizing yarn - worsted weight the sizing varied depending on the brand of each stocking ended up weighing about 12-13g yarn i used but they were usually around 4″ it averaged out to be about 27-30 yds 25-27m 10 cm from the cuff co down to the bend in per stocking multiply that by the number of the heel and about 3 5″ 9 cm from the bend stockings you want to get your total yardage in the heel to the toe and roughly 5 5 14 cm the sample has 9 stockings circumference note worsted is sometimes called medium #4 tutorials yarn in big box stores i believe in the uk >>full video tutorial worsted is called aran and in aus it s called 10 >>german short row tutorial ply notes sample uses a mixture of i love this yarn in note 1 a round is the same thing as a row a light sage big twist twinkle in white and row is just called a round when you are working impeccable in red hot all acrylic yarns in the round note 2 this pattern is written for the solid needles color version find information on using 2 colors *us 8 5 00 mm 32″ 81 cm circumference on page 4 or size needed to match gauge abbreviations other materials >> bobble = bind off yarn needle removable stitch markers >> bor = beginning of round >> co = cast on gauge >> ds = double stitch german short row stockinette - worked in the round technique roughly 18 sts/24 5 rounds = 4″ 10 cm >> k2tog = knit 2 stitches together single gauge is not very important for these you want decrease your stockings to look neat but not too stiff >> k = knit k2 = knit 2 and you don t want large holes around the heel >> p = purl p2 = purl 2 turn area if your stockings are too stiff either go up a needle size or change your yarn and if >> st s = stitch es you are getting large holes around the heel either pull tighter when making a ds or go down a needle size note the needles are linked to affiliate links if you go through that link and make a purchase i may make a small commission more free patterns ivy cardigan | glen echobaby blanket | kodiak cowl | havre cowl popular paid for patterns lofoten sweater | glymur socks | little thun baby sweater | vale beanie | banff cardigan 2021 ©the blue mouse stocking garland |the blue mouse knits 2 pattern begins short row heel you are only going to be working with the co25 stitches note 1 sample uses thelong tail cast on 12 stitches on needle a until otherwise method but you can use whichever noted method you prefer row 1 rs knit across row 2 ws make ds purl across count 12
